info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 5:38PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Siskiyou County through 600 PM PDT... At 536 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Tree Of Heaven Campground, or 12 miles north of Yreka, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and up to half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Tree Of Heaven Campground and Highway 96. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
